verb.description: Take part in a fight, either as sport or in earnest, that involves grappling with one's opponent and trying to throw or force them to the ground.
examples: as the policeman wrestled with the gunman a shot rang out

verb.description: Struggle with a difficulty or problem.
examples: for over a year David wrestled with a guilty conscience

origin: Old English, frequentative of wrǣstan wrest.
